edu.uci.calismall

Class Stroke

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uci.calismall.CaliSmallElement
      • edu.uci.calismall.Stroke
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JSONSerializable, Comparable<CaliSmallElement>

     class Stroke
extends CaliSmallElement
implements JSONSerializable
    Contains a Path and all of the style attributes to be set to the Paint object used to draw it on canvas.

    Every time View.onDraw(android.graphics.Canvas) is called all strokes are rendered according to their styles by updating the Paint object according to what's in this object.

    Author:
    Michele Bonazza

        Stroke()
        Creates an empty stroke.

        Used when deserializing data from JSON.

      • Stroke

        Stroke(Path path,
      Stroke previousStroke)
        Creates a new stroke, called when the user lifts her finger after drawing a line or when the style for the current Path changes.
        Parameters:
        path - the path currently being drawn
        previousStroke - the stroke in use from which style is to be copied, if null all default values are used

      • Stroke

        Stroke(Stroke copy)
        Copy constructor for stroke.

        Paths within the copy stroke will be copied into new paths associated with this stroke.

        Parameters:
        copy - the stroke to be copied

    • Method Detail

      • addAndDrawPoint

        public boolean addAndDrawPoint(PointF newPoint,
                      float touchTolerance)
        Adds a point to this stroke if it's at least touchTolerance far from the last point of this stroke.

        If newPoint is too close to the previous point it's not added and this method returns false.

        This method assumes that setStart(PointF) has been called once for this Stroke.

        Parameters:
        newPoint - the new point to be added to this stroke
        touchTolerance - the distance from the last point in this Stroke under which newPoint is to be ignored
        Returns:
        true if the point has been added to this stroke

      • getPath

        public Path getPath()
        Returns the vector path for this stroke.
        Returns:
        the path

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns whether this stroke is empty, i.e. if it only contains an empty path.
        Returns:
        true if the underlying path is empty

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a reference to this object, so calls can be chained

      • getStyle

        public Paint.Style getStyle()
        Returns the style for this stroke.
        Returns:

      • setStart

        public Stroke setStart(PointF startPoint)
        Sets the first point of this stroke.

        This method must be called first before any call to addAndDrawPoint(PointF, float) can be performed.

        Parameters:
        startPoint - the first point of this stroke, adjusted for the current zoom level and panning
        Returns:
        a reference to this object, so calls can be chained

        public PointF getStartPoint()
        Returns the first point in this stroke.
        Returns:

        public void fixIfRect(Matrix matrix,
             float rotation)
        If this stroke is a rounded rectangle, fixes the radius according to the scale values in the argument matrix and the rectangle according to the argument rotation.
        Parameters:
        matrix - the matrix containing scale values.
        rotation -

      • setBoundaries

        public Stroke setBoundaries()
        Computes the boundaries for this stroke.

        To be called after onDown(), when the stroke is complete.

        Returns:
        a reference to this object, so calls can be chained

      • listPoints

        public String listPoints()
        Returns a list of all points that are part of this stroke.
        Returns:
        a comma separated list of points that make part of this stroke

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this stroke, clearing all points.

        After a call to this method, setStart(PointF) must be called again to use this stroke.

      • setRoundRect

        public void setRoundRect(Path newPath,
                RectF border,
                float radius)
        Resets this stroke replacing its path with the argument path and replacing the current points with the 4 corners of the argument border.

        While the path is needed to draw this stroke for this session, the rectangle and the radius are used for inclusion tests and for saving/restoring this object's state to disk/network.

        Parameters:
        newPath - the new path that replaces this stroke's
        border - the rectangle enclosing the path
        radius - the radius with which the rectangle should be rounded

      • getPointsForInclusionTests

        public List<PointF> getPointsForInclusionTests()
        Description copied from class: CaliSmallElement
        Returns a list of all points that must be tested when performing inclusion tests.

        This method is not required to make defensive copies, so altering the returned may alter the internal state of the object.

        Specified by:
        getPointsForInclusionTests in class CaliSmallElement
        Returns:
        a list containing all points of this element that must be included within some area for this element to be contained within said area
